# Luigi Container Events

This document outlines the events provided by the Luigi Container.<br/>
Some events contain an additional payload which can be utilized for internal objectives.<br/>
In addition you can use standard `addEventListener` function to react on events emmitted by the Luigi Container. Source list of all events can be found [here](https://github.com/luigi-project/luigi/blob/main/container/src/constants/communication.ts).

## Event Reference

<!-- Generated by documentation.js. Update this documentation by updating the source code. -->

<a name="Events.CUSTOM_MESSAGE"></a>

### Events.CUSTOM\_MESSAGE ⇒ <code>void</code>
<p>Event fired when the micro frontend sends a custom message.</p>


| Payload | Type | Description |
| --- | --- | --- |
| => | <code>Object</code> | <p>[https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Object](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Object)</p> |

**Properties**

| Name | Type | Description |
| --- | --- | --- |
| data | <code>object</code> | <p>event data</p> |
| id | <code>string</code> | <p>event ID</p> |

**Example**  
```js
{
 data: {},
 id: 'some-id'
}
```
<br>  
<a name="Events.NAVIGATION_REQUEST"></a>

### Events.NAVIGATION\_REQUEST ⇒ <code>void</code>
<p>Event fired when a navigation has been requested by the micro frontend. <br><br>
Payload: <a href="https://github.com/luigi-project/luigi/blob/main/container/typings/constants/event-payloads.ts">NavigationRequestPayload</a></p>


| Payload | Type | Description |
| --- | --- | --- |
| => | <code>NavigationRequestPayload</code> | <p>[https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Object](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Object)</p> |

**Example**  
```js
{
 fromClosestContext: false,
 fromContext: null,
 fromParent: true,
 fromVirtualTreeRoot: false,
 link: '/test/route',
 nodeParams: {}
}
```
<br>  
<a name="Events.ALERT_REQUEST"></a>

### Events.ALERT\_REQUEST ⇒ <code>void</code>
<p>Event fired when the micro frontend requests to show an alert. <br>
Read more about <code>showAlert</code> params <a href="https://docs.luigi-project.io/docs/luigi-core-api?section=showalert">here</a>. <br><br>
Payload: <a href="https://github.com/luigi-project/luigi/blob/main/container/typings/constants/event-payloads.ts">AlertRequestPayload</a></p>


| Payload | Type | Description |
| --- | --- | --- |
| => | <code>AlertRequestPayload</code> | <p>[https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Object](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Object)</p> |

**Example**  
```js
{
 text: 'Custom alert message',
 type: 'info',
 links: {
  goToHome: { text: 'Homepage', url: '/overview' },
  goToOtherProject: { text: 'Other project', url: '/projects/pr2' },
  relativePath: { text: 'Hide side nav', url: 'hideSideNav' },
  neverShowItAgain: { text: 'Never show it again', dismissKey: 'neverShowItAgain' }
 },
 closeAfter: 3000
}
```
<br>  
<a name="Events.INITIALIZED"></a>

### Events.INITIALIZED ⇒ <code>void</code>
<p>Event fired when the micro frontend has been initialized.</p>


| Payload | Type | Description |
| --- | --- | --- |
| unspecified | <code>\*</code> | <p>type is not relevant in this case</p> |

<br>  
<a name="Events.ADD_SEARCH_PARAMS_REQUEST"></a>

### Events.ADD\_SEARCH\_PARAMS\_REQUEST ⇒ <code>void</code>
<p>Event fired when the micro frontend requests the addition of search parameters to the URL. <br><br>
Payload: <a href="https://github.com/luigi-project/luigi/blob/main/container/typings/constants/event-payloads.ts">ParamsRequestPayload</a></p>


| Payload | Type | Description |
| --- | --- | --- |
| => | <code>ParamsRequestPayload</code> | <p>[https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Object](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Object)</p> |

**Example**  
```js
{
 data: {},
 keepBrowserHistory: false
}
```
<br>  
<a name="Events.ADD_NODE_PARAMS_REQUEST"></a>

### Events.ADD\_NODE\_PARAMS\_REQUEST ⇒ <code>void</code>
<p>Event fired when the micro frontend requests the addition of node parameters to the URL. <br><br>
Payload: <a href="https://github.com/luigi-project/luigi/blob/main/container/typings/constants/event-payloads.ts">ParamsRequestPayload</a></p>


| Payload | Type | Description |
| --- | --- | --- |
| => | <code>ParamsRequestPayload</code> | <p>[https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Object](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Object)</p> |

**Example**  
```js
{
 data: {},
 keepBrowserHistory: false
}
```
<br>  
<a name="Events.SHOW_CONFIRMATION_MODAL_REQUEST"></a>

### Events.SHOW\_CONFIRMATION\_MODAL\_REQUEST ⇒ <code>void</code>
<p>Event fired when the micro frontend requests to show a confirmation modal. <br>
Read more about <code>showConfirmationModal</code> params <a href="https://docs.luigi-project.io/docs/luigi-core-api?section=showconfirmationmodal">here</a>. <br><br>
Payload: <a href="https://github.com/luigi-project/luigi/blob/main/container/typings/constants/event-payloads.ts">ConfirmationModalRequestPayload</a></p>


| Payload | Type | Description |
| --- | --- | --- |
| => | <code>ConfirmationModalRequestPayload</code> | <p>[https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Object](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Object)</p> |

**Example**  
```js
{
 header: 'Confirmation',
 body: 'Are you sure you want to do this?',
 buttonConfirm: 'Yes',
 buttonDismiss: 'No'
}
```
<br>

| Payload | Type | Description |
| --- | --- | --- |
| unspecified | <code>\*</code> | <p>type is not relevant in this case</p> |

<a name="Events.SET_CURRENT_LOCALE_REQUEST"></a>

### Events.SET\_CURRENT\_LOCALE\_REQUEST ⇒ <code>void</code>
<p>Event fired when the micro frontend requests to set the current locale.</p>


| Payload | Type | Description |
| --- | --- | --- |
| => | <code>Object.&lt;string, string&gt;</code> | <p>[https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Object](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Object)</p> |

**Example**  
```js
{
 currentLocale: 'en'
}
```
<br>  
<a name="Events.LOCAL_STORAGE_SET_REQUEST"></a>

### Events.LOCAL\_STORAGE\_SET\_REQUEST ⇒ <code>void</code>
<p>Event fired when the micro frontend requests to modify the local storage.</p>


| Payload | Type | Description |
| --- | --- | --- |
| => | <code>Object.&lt;string, string&gt;</code> | <p>[https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Object](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Object)</p> |

**Example**  
```js
{
 key: 'luigi-version',
 value: '2.21.0'
}
```
<br>  
<a name="Events.RUNTIME_ERROR_HANDLING_REQUEST"></a>

### Events.RUNTIME\_ERROR\_HANDLING\_REQUEST ⇒ <code>void</code>
<p>Event fired when the micro frontend requests to handle errors that might happen during the runtime of the micro frontend.</p>


| Payload | Type | Description |
| --- | --- | --- |
| unspecified | <code>\*</code> | <p>type is not relevant in this case</p> |

<br>  
<a name="Events.SET_ANCHOR_LINK_REQUEST"></a>

### Events.SET\_ANCHOR\_LINK\_REQUEST ⇒ <code>void</code>
<p>Event fired when the micro frontend requests to set the anchor of the URL.</p>


| Payload | Type | Description |
| --- | --- | --- |
| => | <code>String</code> | <p>[https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/String](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/String)</p> |

**Example**  
```js
'some-anchor'
```

<a name="Events.GET_CURRENT_ROUTE_REQUEST"></a>

### Events.GET\_CURRENT\_ROUTE\_REQUEST ⇒ <code>void</code>
<p>Event fired when the micro frontend requests the current app route. <br><br>
Payload: <a href="https://github.com/luigi-project/luigi/blob/main/container/typings/constants/event-payloads.ts">CurrentRouteRequestPayload</a></p>


| Payload | Type | Description |
| --- | --- | --- |
| => | <code>CurrentRouteRequestPayload</code> | <p>[https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Object](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Object)</p> |

**Example**  
```js
{
 fromClosestContext: false,
 fromContext: null,
 fromParent: true,
 fromVirtualTreeRoot: false,
 nodeParams: {}
}
```
<br>  
<a name="Events.NAVIGATION_COMPLETED_REPORT"></a>

### Events.NAVIGATION\_COMPLETED\_REPORT ⇒ <code>void</code>
<p>Event fired to report that the micro frontend's navigation has completed.</p>


| Payload | Type | Description |
| --- | --- | --- |
| unspecified | <code>\*</code> | <p>type is not relevant in this case</p> |

<br>  
<a name="Events.UPDATE_MODAL_PATH_DATA_REQUEST"></a>

### Events.UPDATE\_MODAL\_PATH\_DATA\_REQUEST ⇒ <code>void</code>
<p>Event fired when the micro frontend requests to update the modal path parameters. <br><br>
Payload: <a href="https://github.com/luigi-project/luigi/blob/main/container/typings/constants/event-payloads.ts">ModalPathDataRequestPayload</a></p>


| Payload | Type | Description |
| --- | --- | --- |
| => | <code>ModalPathDataRequestPayload</code> | <p>[https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Object](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Object)</p> |

**Example**  
```js
{
 fromClosestContext: false,
 fromContext: null,
 fromParent: true,
 fromVirtualTreeRoot: false,
 history: true,
 link: '/test/route',
 modal: { title: 'Some modal' },
 nodeParams: {}
}
```
<br>  
<a name="Events.UPDATE_MODAL_SETTINGS_REQUEST"></a>

### Events.UPDATE\_MODAL\_SETTINGS\_REQUEST ⇒ <code>void</code>
<p>Event fired when the micro frontend requests to update the modal settings. <br>
Read more about <code>updateModalSettings</code> params <a href="https://docs.luigi-project.io/docs/luigi-client-api?section=updatemodalsettings">here</a>. <br><br>
Payload: <a href="https://github.com/luigi-project/luigi/blob/main/container/typings/constants/event-payloads.ts">ModalSettingsRequestPayload</a></p>


| Payload | Type | Description |
| --- | --- | --- |
| => | <code>ModalSettingsRequestPayload</code> | <p>[https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Object](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Object)</p> |

**Example**  
```js
{
 addHistoryEntry: true,
 updatedModalSettings: {}
}
```
<br>  
<a name="Events.CHECK_PATH_EXISTS_REQUEST"></a>

### Events.CHECK\_PATH\_EXISTS\_REQUEST ⇒ <code>void</code>
<p>Event fired when the micro frontend requests to check the validity of a path.</p>


| Payload | Type | Description |
| --- | --- | --- |
| => | <code>Object.&lt;string, string&gt;</code> | <p>[https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Object](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Object)</p> |

**Example**  
```js
{
 link: '/test/route'
}
```
<br>  
<a name="Events.SET_DIRTY_STATUS_REQUEST"></a>

### Events.SET\_DIRTY\_STATUS\_REQUEST ⇒ <code>void</code>
<p>Event fired when the micro frontend requests to set the 'dirty status' which, for example, avoids closing when there are any unsaved changes.</p>


| Payload | Type | Description |
| --- | --- | --- |
| => | <code>Object.&lt;string, boolean&gt;</code> | <p>[https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Object](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Object)</p> |

**Example**  
```js
{
 dirty: true
}
```
<br>  
<a name="Events.SET_VIEW_GROUP_DATA_REQUEST"></a>

### Events.SET\_VIEW\_GROUP\_DATA\_REQUEST ⇒ <code>void</code>
<p>Event fired when the micro frontend requests to set the view group data.</p>


| Payload | Type | Description |
| --- | --- | --- |
| => | <code>Object.&lt;string, unknown&gt;</code> | <p>[https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Object](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Object)</p> |

**Example**  
```js
{
 vg: 'some data'
}
```
<br>  
<a name="Events.GO_BACK_REQUEST"></a>

### Events.GO\_BACK\_REQUEST ⇒ <code>void</code>
<p>Event fired when the micro frontend requests to navigate back.</p>


| Payload | Type | Description |
| --- | --- | --- |
| => | <code>Object.&lt;string, unknown&gt;</code> | <p>[https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Object](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Object)</p> |

**Example**  
```js
{
 ctx: 'some context'
}
```
<br>

### Events.REMOVE\_BACKDROP\_REQUEST ⇒ <code>void</code>

| Payload | Type | Description |
| --- | --- | --- |
| unspecified | <code>\*</code> | <p>type is not relevant in this case</p> |
